chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI Cause Injury (2+) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI Cause Injury (2+) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Dallas James Richardson was found guilty of OWI Cause Injury (2+), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.
  • Dallas James Richardson was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

-AODA and any counseling/treatment deemed appropriate.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Random tests.
-Submit DNA sample.
-Pay supervision fees.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Defendant eligible for Substance Abuse Program after serving 20 months of his sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs are due during term of supervision.  Dept of Corrections to collect from defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account, an amount or a percentage which the department determines is reasonable.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

-  Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.
-  No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. No possession of drug paraphernalia.
- Defendant to maintain employment.
- Pay supervision fees.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Court costs due during probation term on Ct. 1 on 15CF133. A civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due, if not paid during probation term on Ct. 1.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
